intro: Eustylis triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered eustylis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters of three. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils. Eustylis triflora is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
